1)Assure the victim and do not let him panic. When under panic, it will enhance heart rate and would circulate the venom faster in the body. 

2)Remove any rings or constricting items; the affected area may swell. 

3)Stop lymphatic spread of venom - bandage firmly, splint and immobilise. The limb, which has been affected by the bite, should be immobilized with splint. 

4)Keep victim's hand as close to the level of the heart as possible as to slow the blood flow. 

5)Do not allow the victim to eat or to drink water in order to keep metabolism at low rate. No water No food is the golden rule. 

6)DO NOT COVER THE BITE AREA AND PUNCTURE MARKS. The wound should be gently cleaned with antiseptic.
